package.name: DB_DataContainer
package.description: Provides persistence layer for object data to be stored in PEAR DB supported databases. Included common methods for saving, retrieving and deleting data with automatic query generation. Multiobject retrieving supported with static function call. Runtime generation of accessor methods supported with recent PHP. generation.

release.notes: * load() and getObjects() now ignore extra columns in database which do not have a matching property name pairs * $table now defaults to classname * sibling is now overloaded by default if working overload extension available * constructor in sibling is now optional * BUGFIX: load() returned an array insted of true on successfull load * slightly improved regression tests
* load() now returns an PEAR_Error if SELECT returned no data or if SELECT returned more than exactly one row. * load() converts all column names to lowercase before setting the object properties
* Hardcoded queries were silently ignored (bug noticed by Pierfrancesco Marsiaj) * Added regressions tests for hardcoded queries and delete() method
* If given numeric non-array $params parameter to the constructor it is considered to be the $id * Unified regression tests
* Stable release * Fixes mssql LIMIT problems * Fixes mssql regression tests
* Regression tests for postgres, mysql and mssql added * E_ALL fixes
* Overloaded accessor methods are now handled more intelligently.
* Support for autogenerating accessor methods in runtime added.
* First release candidate. * Uses DB::autoExecute() instead of internally building the queries. * Tested to work with Postgres and MySQL
